title: Tewu 01
description: Comprehensive practice test covering Governance, Stakeholder Engagement, and Life Cycle Management.

questions.text: The Aligning Process Group: (Moderate)

options.text: How portfolio components will be evaluated in the portfolio
How portfolio components will be categorized in the portfolio
How portfolio components will be selected for inclusion in the portfolio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: You are currently engaged in working with focus groups and brainstorming activities to develop the portfolio management plan. What best describes what you are doing? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 5.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The Authorizing and Controlling Process Group: (Moderate)

options.text: Consists of the processes for determining how to authorize the portfolio
Consists of processes for selecting components to the portfolio
Consists of the processes for determining how to authorize the portfolio and providing ongoing oversight of the portfolio
Consists of the processes for providing ongoing portfolio oversight

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Ben comes to you for advice. He understands that there is a strategic management process but is unsure of what stage in the process he is in. He is currently doing a strategic alignment analysis. What phase is he in? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The development of the Portfolio Strategic Plan process includes the following outputs: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How does a portfolio manager address the function of marketing? (Moderate)

options.text: Not a factor as portfolio managers look at multiple areas
Analyzing Market opportunity and competitive advantage

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.7 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The following are all examples of categories that the portfolio component along with its key descriptors can be assigned to except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 5.2.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Rob has just started working on the Develop Portfolio Risk Management Plan process. He is trying to find information on roles and responsibilities for conducting risk management. Where can Rob find this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Roles and responsibilities are defined in the portfolio management plan. Refer to Section 8.1.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: You have been asked to complete a portfolio roadmap. What do you need to start the process? (Moderate)

options.text: Portfolio strategic plan, portfolio charter, portfolio management plan
Portfolio process assets, portfolio charter, readiness assessment
Portfolio charter, portfolio, portfolio process assets
Portfolio strategic plan, portfolio charter, portfolio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is success measured for portfolio management? (Easy)

options.text: Just generically in terms of how successful the portfolio is
In terms of the aggregate investment performance and benefit realization of the portfolio
Whether it satisfies the needs and benefits for which the portfolio was initially undertaken
As measured by the success of the managers

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is the portfolio strategic plan used within the Define Portfolio process? (Moderate)

options.text: It is used to describe the approach and intent of management in identifying, approving, and procuring portfolio components
It is not used in this process
It is used to align the portfolio with organizational strategy and objectives including the use of the prioritization model
It is used to identify and categorize qualified portfolio components

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 5.2.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is portfolio value defined? (Moderate)

options.text: It is defined as the aggregate value delivered by the portfolio components
It is defined only by quantitative metrics
It is defined by the implementation success of its components
It is defined only in terms of financial value such as revenue growth and increased operating margins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 6.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is SWOT analysis used within the Manage Portfolio Value process? (Moderate)

options.text: It is used to score and measure organizational value
It is used to measure revenue growth and operating margins
It is used to show the cause and effect relationships between portfolio components
It is used to elicit information to ensure benefits are comprehensively and holistically taken into consideration

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Lee is working on the Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan process. He is trying to determine the optimal type of communication for the stakeholders. Which process involved in a stakeholder analysis will help Lee make this assessment? (Difficult)

options.text: Assigning stakeholders into groups and classifying them as external or internal
Assigning stakeholders into groups and classifying them as critical or non-critical
Assigning stakeholders into groups and classifying them as influential or non-influential
Assigning stakeholders into groups and classifying them as key or executive

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. This is identified in the Standard as a key part of a stakeholder analysis. Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: All of the following are key descriptors of portfolio components that a portfolio manager may make use of except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.2.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio of operational projects links a subset of recurring activities managed as projects to the organizationsâ€™: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.7 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio manager must have expertise in ALL of the following application and analysis of quantitative and qualitative techniques except: (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 1.8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio management plan contains which of the following? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio strategic plan key contents are: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio strategic plan: (Moderate)

options.text: Is a key source to ensure the organization will meet its objectives
Has nothing to do with the portfolio
Is a key source to ensure the organization will meet its project demands
Is a key source to ensure the organization will meet its financial obligations

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio performance management plan is a subsidiary plan. What is it a subsidiary plan of? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 6.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio management plan defines all of the following for the risk management plan except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 8.1.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The risk management plan can be a component of which of the following? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Tina has recently started working on the Manage Supply and Demand process. She is trying to find the guidelines for reporting delays due to a constraint on resources. Where can Tina find this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The high level guidelines for these types of situations are found in the portfolio management plan. Refer to Section 6.2.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Gina is ready to apply tools and techniques within the Optimize Portfolio process. What tools and techniques are typically applied during this process? (Moderate)

options.text: Weighted ranking and scoring techniques, portfolio component inventory, graphical analytical methods
Portfolio component categorization techniques, readiness assessment, enterprise environmental factors
Portfolio component categorization techniques, portfolio component inventory, weighted ranking and scoring techniques
Capability and capacity analysis, weighted ranking and scoring techniques, quantitative and qualitative analysis, graphical analytical methods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Tools and techniques defined in The Standard for Optimize Portfolio. Refer to Section 5.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In a simple prioritization model, what can scoring elements be based on? (Moderate)

options.text: Strategic alignment, financial costs, risks, and dependencies
Enterprise environmental factors, portfolio process assets, portfolio strategic plan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 4.1.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: A sample of risk categories in the risk management plan includes all of the following except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8.1.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Brianna comes to you for advice and believes she has completed the Manage Portfolio Information process. She shows you that she has completed portfolio reports. What is she missing? (Moderate)

options.text: Portfolio management plan updates, portfolio process assets updates
Portfolio charter updates, portfolio process assets updates
Portfolio charter updates, portfolio management plan updates
Portfolio roadmap updates, portfolio process assets updates

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Outputs of Manage Portfolio Information. Refer to Section 7/Figure 7-1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Negative risks not identified and treated become: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8.2.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Vince comes to you for advice. He recently started working on his portfolio roadmap but he is noticing that not all of his portfolio components are identified. How would you advise Vince? (Difficult)

options.text: That roadmaps may not provide details of all identified portfolio components, but can be used to build details later
That roadmaps focus on the detailed aspects of the portfolio components and that all components should be clearly detailed
That roadmaps show components at a high level and very few portfolio components have any detail

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 4.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Bryce has been tasked to develop a portfolio strategic plan. Bryce is struggling with where to start. What should Bryce use as a good starting point? (Difficult)

options.text: Enterprise environmental factors, portfolio component inventory, organizational process assets
Portfolio charter, portfolio roadmap, organizational strategy and objectives
Prioritization analysis, portfolio process assets, portfolio roadmap
Organizational strategy and objectives, inventory of work, portfolio process assets

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Process Assets include which of the following: (Easy)

options.text: Information on risk and performance data

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which best describes risk tolerance? (Moderate)

options.text: Organization's willingness to develop comprehensive risk management plan
Threshold or attitude of the organization towards the positive or negative effects of risk on the portfolio
Threshold or attitude of the organization towards the negative effects of risk on the portfolio

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following does not impact strategy relative to a portfolio plan? (Moderate)

options.text: Evaluation of a project or program manager

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following services does a portfolio management office NOT provide to a program or project management office: (Moderate)

options.text: Formulating project and program management standards

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.9 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text:
Which of the following is an interaction with a portfolio management process group?
(Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Process Assets include which of the following:

options.text: Information on techniques, models and tools

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the four Portfolio Strategic Management processes enables the portfolio manager to make changes in organizational strategy and to enhance the ability to accept and and act on significant strategic change that impacts portfolio planning and management? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 4.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is the least important evaluation criterion that a portfolio manager should use? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an example of a portfolio report? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 5.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following quantitative or qualitative tools and techniques are applicable for optimizing a portfolio? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.3.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following can be a Portfolio Management Information System? (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.4.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following activities are performed during the Provide Portfolio Oversight process? (Moderate)

options.text: Conducting recurring and nonrecurring governance meetings for reviews and decision making
Reporting portfolio changes and information on resources, risks, performance, and financials
Reviewing information on portfolio resources, risks, performance, and financial information

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Portfolio Performance Management process? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of resource capability and capability management analysis? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.1.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Dashboards are: (Moderate)

options.text: Effective way to communicate multiple messages on portfolio risk and trending simultaneously
Effective way to communicate multiple messages on portfolio communication and trending simultaneously
Effective way to communicate multiple messages on portfolio plan and trending simultaneously
Effective way to communicate multiple messages on portfolio status and trending simultaneously

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 7.2.2.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of value scoring and measurement analysis? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.3.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a Tool or Technique for the Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 7.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is a classification of stakeholders? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a tool or technique for the Manage Portfolio Information process? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 7.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of risk conditions that may exist in an organization's environment that may contribute to portfolio risk? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following Enterprise Environmental Factors as inputs to planning for risk management is least relevant? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8.1.1.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following are investment choice tools? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 8.1.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which process within portfolio communication management executes the communication plan by collecting data, translating data into meaningful information, and supplying it to identified stakeholders in a timely manner? (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 7 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Mitchell is a portfolio manager and is currently working on the Develop Portfolio Management Plan. He comes to you for advice. Mitchell knows that he needs to plan to develop and report on predefined and preapproved metrics. However, Mitchell isn't sure what these metrics are used to monitor. How would you advise him? (Difficult)

options.text: I would tell Mitchell that the metrics are used to monitor strategic goal achievement, financial contribution, stakeholder satisfaction, risk profile, and resource utilization
I would tell Mitchell that the metrics are mainly used to monitor profitability
I would advise Mitchell that the metrics are mainly used to determine if portfolio components are having a positive or negative influence on the portfolio
I would advise Mitchell that the metrics are used almost exclusively to monitor resource utilization

questions.explanation: Metrics are used to monitor strategic goal achievement, financial contribution, stakeholder satisfaction, risk profile, and resource utilization. Refer to Section 6.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and

questions.text: In creating a Stakeholder Matrix for use in Stakeholder Analysis, which of the following is not analyzed? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: To define the management of strategic change the following inputs are needed: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: What role does the portfolio charter play in the Manage Strategic Change process? (Easy)

options.text: The original charter should only be consulted to ensure that the strategic goals are still in alignment with the original charter
The charter does not play a role in this process
The charter does not get updated and is static once it is created
The original or revised charter should be reviewed to ensure that the charter and portfolio remain in alignment are updated as required

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.4.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Dwayne is currently working on the Manage Supply and Demand process. He is currently in the process of studying skill sets and certifications and trying to match them up against the portfolio's objectives and goals to try to meet the portfolio demands as much as possible. What type of analysis is Dwayne performing? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The situation describes a study of capability and capacity. Refer to Section 6.2.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In developing the portfolio for the Portfolio Governance Model, which of the following is not a tool or technique? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 5.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In developing the process for Optimize the Portfolio, which of the following is not a tool or technique? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Cindy is working on developing the portfolio charter. As she is working on the charter, she keeps finding different constraints in the form of corporate and government policies. What is Cindy describing? (Moderate)

options.text: The impact of portfolio process assets
The impact of a portfolio roadmap
The impact of a scenario analysis
The impact of enterprise environmental factors

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.2.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Some examples of internal risks include all of the following except: (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Once the Portfolio Strategic Plan is developed, it should contain which of the following key contents? (Difficult)

options.text: Key assumptions, resources required, measurable goals, scenario analysis
Resources required by type and quantity, risk tolerance, portfolio strategic plan update, portfolio process assets updates
Portfolio strategic plan, risk tolerance, capability and capacity analysis
Portfolio prioritization model, portfolio benefits, allocation of funds to different types of initiatives, organizational structure and organization areas

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Jeremy is working on developing a portfolio strategic plan. He is trying to find a tool or technique that will focus on the changing the organizational strategy and objectives and showing where gaps in focus, investment, or alignment exist within the portfolio. What tool and technique should Jeremy use? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Karen comes to you for advice. She is about to start working on the Manage Portfolio Information process. She has the portfolio and the portfolio management plan. What is Karen missing that she will need to start this process? (Difficult)

options.text: Portfolio reports, portfolio component reports, portfolio process assets
Portfolio charter, organizational process assets, enterprise environmental factors
Portfolio component reports, portfolio roadmap, portfolio process assets
Enterprise environmental factors, portfolio reports, portfolio charter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Inputs to Manage Portfolio Information. Refer to Section 7/Figure 7-1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: James has been advised that organization strategy has changed. He understands that he needs to manage this strategic change. What should James ensure that the portfolio remains in alignment with? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.4.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Ernest is currently involved in reporting portfolio changes and information on resources, risks, performance, and financials. He is also ensuring compliance with organizational standards. Which portfolio governance process is Ernest involved in? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The two activities described are done during Provide Portfolio Oversight. Refer to Section 5.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Performance metrics are the mechanism used for targeting areas of measurement for assessing how the mix or portfolio components are performing. Quantitative measures include all of the following except: (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Maggie is working on the performance management plan. She knows that there are three key things that she needs to document regarding how the organization plans to measure, monitor, control, and report on them. What are they? (Difficult)

options.text: Portfolio performance, resource management, portfolio value
Portfolio management, portfolio value, portfolio status
Portfolio value, portfolio value planning, portfolio management
Resource management, portfolio value, portfolio status

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. This is defined in the Standard where it states that the performance management plan documents how the organization plans to measures, monitor and control portfolio performance, resource management, and portfolio value. Refer to Section 6.1 of the Standa

questions.text: Michael is developing a portfolio strategic plan. He is having difficulty understanding the objectives, expected benefits, performance, and prioritization criteria. What tool and technique would you recommend to Michael? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Perhaps the most common tool used to demonstrate progress is a: (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of resource capability and capacity management analysis? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.1.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Within the Manage Portfolio Risks process, which of the following are fallback plans a risk owner would consider should the originally selected risk strategy not be successful? (Difficult)

options.text: Risk methodology, risk roles and responsibilities, risk frequency
Response strategy selection, strategies for both threats and opportunities, scenario analysis
Risk methodology, strategies for both threats and opportunities
Response strategy selection, strategies for both threats and opportunities, risk frequency

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Per the Standard, a risk owner should have a fallback plan for execution if the originally selected strategy is not successful. Refer to Section 8.2.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Within the portfolio strategic plan, what is useful as a decision framework to structure the portfolio components? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.2.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Within portfolio performance management, what does portfolio reporting provide? (Difficult)

options.text: It enables the portfolio sponsors to quickly understand the status of a portfolio's progress
It provides stakeholders and the governing body with metrics to determine where the portfolio is meeting the organization strategy

It provides those responsible for executing portfolio components with meaningful information on the status of the respective portfolio components in the context of other components and the overall portfolio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Anthony has come to you for advice. He believes that he has completed the Optimize Portfolio process. However, he doesn't appear to have any of the normal outputs for the process. What should he have? (Difficult)

options.text: Portfolio updates, portfolio charter updates, portfolio management plan updates, portfolio reports, portfolio process asset updates
Portfolio charter, portfolio roadmap, portfolio management plan
Portfolio updates, portfolio roadmap updates, portfolio management plan updates
Portfolio updates, portfolio roadmap updates, portfolio management plan updates, portfolio reports, portfolio process asset updates

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Outputs of the Optimize Portfolio. Refer to Section 5.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Business value may be created by: (Easy)

options.text: The effective change in present operations
The effective management of ongoing operations

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 1.6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: During the alignment of the organizational strategy and objectives, the portfolio manager refers to and is guided by the portfolio's plans, policies, procedures, and guidelines. What is the portfolio manager referencing? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.1.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: During the Provide Portfolio Oversight process, Keith holds regular meetings to review the current status of the portfolio and determine if any changes are necessary. What tool and technique is Keith utilizing? (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.5.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Christy is working on defining a portfolio roadmap. She needs to use a tool which will identify portfolio dependencies as it relates to other portfolios. What tool and technique should be used? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.3.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: As it relates to the Authorize Portfolio process, what information does the portfolio management plan provide? (Moderate)

options.text: It describes the process to authorize the portfolio components to allow and reallocate resources and funding and to define the key communication needs within the portfolio management process
It is used to describe the approach and intent of management in identifying, approving, and procuring portfolio components
It contains relevant data, tools, and templates regarding the portfolio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 5.4.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Ricardo has all of the inputs for the Develop Portfolio Communication Plan. He comes to you for advice as he is overwhelmed with the information and isn't sure where to start in terms of analyzing it. How would you advise Ricardo to proceed in terms of applying tools and techniques? (Moderate)

options.text: Gap analysis, communication methods, portfolio component reports
Elicitation techniques, portfolio management information system, communication requirements analysis, communication methods
Stakeholder analysis, elicitation techniques, communication requirements analysis

questions.explanation: Tools and techniques of Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan. Refer to Section 7/Figure 7-1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Hank runs the portfolio management office within his organization. He is currently working on the Develop Portfolio Management Plan process. Some stakeholders have identified metrics that they believe no longer support organizational strategy. What should Hank do as director of the PMO? (Difficult)

options.text: He should eliminate the metrics the stakeholders identified but not add any new ones at this time
He should develop new metrics which better match organizational strategy
He should develop a very large number of new metrics to show the stakeholders that he is trying to create metrics that are better aligned with organizational strategy
He should explain to the stakeholders that the metrics cannot be changed at this point in the process

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. New metrics should be developed which are in better alignment with organization strategy. As part of this process, a large number of new metrics should not be developed as it can overwhelm stakeholders. Refer to Section 6.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfo

questions.text: Becky is working on the process of managing strategic change. She has all of the inputs to the process but is unfamiliar with the tools and techniques typically used. What should she be using? (Moderate)

options.text: Readiness assessment, stakeholder analysis, prioritization analysis
Stakeholder analysis, gap analysis, readiness assessment
Portfolio process assets, portfolio charter, gap analysis
Stakeholder analysis, gap analysis, capability and capacity analysis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Bill is working on the Manage Portfolio Information process. He has all of the inputs to the process. What tools and techniques would Bill typically apply during this process? (Moderate)

options.text: Elicitation techniques, portfolio management information system, communication requirements analysis, communication methods
Stakeholder analysis, elicitation techniques, communication requirements analysis
Portfolio management information system, elicitation techniques, communication requirements analysis
Portfolio management information system, communication requirements analysis, communication methods, stakeholder analysis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Tools and techniques of Manage Portfolio Information. Refer to Section 7/Figure 7-1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Stella is nearly finished the Manage Portfolio Information process. She knows that she needs to make note of the announcement of an upcoming stakeholder meeting as well as a portfolio manager meeting. Where would Stella document this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Stakeholder meeting and portfolio manager meeting announcements are part of portfolio reports. Refer to Section 7.2.3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Kelly is nearly finished the Manage Portfolio Value process. During the process, there were some cost savings forecasted. Kelly knows she needs to document this. Where should she document it? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Forecasts of the portfolio are contained within portfolio reports. Refer to Section 6.3.3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In Managing Supply and Demand, the term "Demand" refers to: (Moderate)

options.text: Resource requirements from the portfolio components and from the component proposals requesting resources
Resource from the component proposals requesting resources
Resource requirements from the portfolio components
Resource requirements from the portfolio components and from the component proposals requesting only financial funding

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Examples of PMS Tools and Processes include: (Easy)

options.text: Earned value management processes and tools

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 2.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Examples of Portfolio Process Assets used as inputs to plan for risk management include all of the following except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 8.1.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: When are portfolio process asset updates done? (Easy)

options.text: As an output to the Develop Portfolio Charter process
As an output to the Define Portfolio Roadmap process
As an input to the Develop Portfolio Charter process
As an output to the Develop Portfolio Strategic Plan process

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.2.3.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: When bottleneck resources or resource downtime are identified, what can be applied? (Moderate)

options.text: Resource allocating and project sequencing techniques
Resource minimizing and project ordering techniques
Resource levelling or project sequencing techniques

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.2.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Joan has just started working on the Manage Portfolio Risks process.  She is looking for the portfolio risk register. Where would Joan find this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The portfolio risk register is part of the portfolio. Refer to Section 8.2.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Evan is currently working on the Manage Portfolio Information process. He is currently creating a graphical representation which will allow him to determine if the resulting impact of a priority change is value-added or adverse. What is Evan creating? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. The description provided essentially reflects the definition of resource histogram. Refer to Section 7.2.2.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: When should the portfolio process assets be updated? (Difficult)

options.text: If strategic changes have been made which impact portfolio plans and processes, then the portfolio process assets should be updated
If stakeholder engagement, communication management, performance, and risk sections have changed
If management approach, priorities, or organizational structure have changed

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.4.3.6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Grant is in the process of conducting a prioritization analysis to make an assessment of which portfolio components need to be added, removed or changed. What process is Grant conducting and what is the likely outcome of the process? (Moderate)

options.text: He is in the Develop Portfolio Charter process which will result in the development of a Portfolio Charter
He is in the Manage Strategic Change process which will result in several updates to the Portfolio process and Portfolio roadmap
He is in the Define Portfolio Roadmap process which will result in the creation of the Portfolio roadmap
He is in the Develop Portfolio Strategic Plan process to develop a Strategic Plan.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.1.2.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Josey is currently working on the Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan process. She is currently performing an analysis to determine stakeholdersâ€™ concerns, interests, and influence. What type of analysis is Josey performing? (Easy)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Jacob is currently working on the Manage Portfolio Value process. He is currently holding meetings with stakeholders to assess criteria and to discern the weight assigned to different benefits and outcomes. What tool and technique is Jacob applying? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Holding meetings with stakeholders is an elicitation technique. Refer to Section 6.3.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Tyson has recently started working on the Manage Portfolio Information process. He is trying to find information on portfolio communication requirements including communication technology available and allowed communication media. Where should Tyson look for this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Communication requirements are found in portfolio process assets. Refer to Section 7.2.1.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Jason has just started working on the Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan. He has the portfolio and the portfolio roadmap. What else should Jason have to start this process? (Moderate)

options.text: Portfolio reports, portfolio management plan, portfolio process assets
Portfolio charter, portfolio component reports, enterprise environmental factors
Portfolio process assets, enterprise environmental factors, portfolio reports
Portfolio reports, portfolio management plan, portfolio charter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Inputs to Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan. Refer to Section 7/Figure 7-1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: A tool and technique for managing strategic change is stakeholder analysis. Why is this important? (Moderate)

options.text: Helps to ensure continuity and align key stakeholders expectations with the changing strategy and resulting portfolio alignment
Helps to ensure continuity of portfolio management processes
Helps to ensure continuity and align organization expectations with the changing strategy and resulting portfolio alignment
Helps to ensure continuity and align the project plan with the changing strategy and resulting portfolio alignment

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Conor is currently working on the Provide Portfolio Oversight process. He is currently in the process of conducting a survey. What tool and technique is Conor utilizing? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.5.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Resource capability and capacity management analysis includes all of the following except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.1.2.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Stephanie has been asked by senior executives to determine how much work can be accomplished based on the current resources available. What is she being asked to do? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.2.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In portfolio structural analysis, the portfolio manager should assign what type of reviews? (Moderate)

options.text: Performance review of major resource groups such as employees or contractors
Performance review of major project components
Performance review and reporting roles and responsibilities across each program, project or operational component
Performance review of each program, project or operational component

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 5.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In portfolio component categorization technique, which of the following are examples of "Business imperatives" considerations? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.2.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In portfolio performance management, what is defined as resource capability? (Moderate)

options.text: A competency that enables an organization to execute its operational objectives
A competency that enables an organization to execute its charter
A competency that enables an organization to execute its strategy
A specific competency that enables an organization to execute components and deliver results

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.1.2.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In portfolio reports, what is a sample representation of progress? (Moderate)

options.text: Earned value diagram demonstrating the earned value versus planned value
Burn-down or burn-up chart showing the delivery of a component compared to the portfolio's history
Burn-down or burn-up chart showing the delivery of a component compared to the portfolio's budget or time
Gantt chart demonstrating program or project progress

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.3.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Currently, analysis is being conducted to compare the current portfolio mix and components with the new strategic direction and the "to be" organizational vision. What type of analysis is being performed? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.4.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: In stakeholder analysis which of the following should be considered? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.
